data.title: Language specific settings: Unable to set tab size per language
data.body:
Hey VSCode Team,

Firstly, thank you so much for this much awaited feature! However, it seems that the set of available settings per language is limited. I wanted to set `editor.tabSize` for `javascript` as `2`, which is `4` as the default. But, it doesn't work and my tab size is still `4` for JS files.

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open *User settings*.
2. Add the below setting,
```json
"[javascript]": {
    "editor.tabSize": 2
}
```

data.title: Fix Slow  Markdown Front matter stripping regexp
data.body:
**Bug**
For long/not-terminated frontmatter in a markdown file, we can currently hang the process while trying match it using a regular expression

**Fix**
Use a more efficent regexp to identify the front matter

data.title: Langauge Specific file encoding setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9 stable release
- OS Version: Windows 10

Ability to set default file encoding on a per-language basis.

I have files for older programming languages that I need to open with Codepage 852 or 437 but I can't set the default file encoding on a per language basis.  These files are not in self-contained repositories so setting a workspace-wide setting doesn't work, and for the most part everything else is UTF. I'd like to be able to add a setting in the language configuration to open a file with specific encoding by default and override the workspace   ##default.

data.title: fix flexbox height issue for parameter hint on IE and Safari
data.body:
Fix https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/282 (Safari) and https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/344 (IE11). When setting flexbox item height to `100%`, browser will try to read height of its containing box, which happens to be a flexbox in our case. However browsers' behavior very when handling percentage of height in flexbox, Chrome and Edge is reasonable, Safari sometimes break, IE s***s (its partial support for flexbox).

Here I remove these two `height:100%` so browser will set its height as containing content. @joaomoreno may know if there is any catch when he adds them while implementing scrolling feature in parameter hint widget.

cc @jrieken @alexandrudima

data.title: debugger shows incorrect value on hover when variable names nearly collide
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: osx, el cap

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  mkdir, init project, `npm i -S rxjs`
2. run a debug session on this file: https://gist.github.com/cdaringe/1f2aa8ee1adeef2a291b75870308022a
3. hover the mouse over `action$`, and note that it shows the value for `action`, which is against expectation

in the below example, you can easily see that `action` and `action$` are defined and in scope.  you can also see me hover over `action$` and that the popup renders the value for `action`.  you will _also note_ that the values listed at line end make the same mistake (i.e. line 29).  only the values the the debug pane on the left side of the screen show the correct values.
![screen shot 2017-02-03 at 2 57 47 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1003261/22611826/b2acc154-ea21-11e6-99a0-57a481ec7153.png)

data.title: TypeScript Promises aren't typed correctly
Can't redo after saving the file.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win 10

Hello All,

I'm not sure it did happen also in 1.8.0 version, but I just realized this issue after I updated to 1.9.0.
I frequently edit the code back and forth for check up the result of changes from the web browser.
I **undo** some part and **save** it, then check the browser. I want to **redo** after it, but I can't redo anymore after saving it.

It doesn't matter how many steps I undo it. It happens with even single undo/redo as well. I tried to remove personal setting in **setting.json** and **re-setup** the whole VS code also does not solve the problem at all. I'm going to test with downgrading VS code to 1.8.0, but I asked to my friend who has Mac is okay with both version.

Is anyone know why this happen? It makes me freak out that I lost lot of code before I post this. =\

data.title: [TypeScript] Snippets in String Literals
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0, commit 27240e71
- OS Version: Win10

Snippet completions occur in string literals, where it doesn't make sense to apply them.

![import_snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/22609973/2719a502-ea18-11e6-8293-0fdf4e68f64c.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a ts file with the following contents:
``` ts
import x =  require('cl')
```
2. Place the caret after the `l`
3. Trigger completions (Ctrl+Space)
4. Observe that the `class` snippet is a completion option.

## Expected

No snippet completions occur in string literals

## Observed

They do.

data.title: Add ellipsis to path in quick open
data.body:
Addresses https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18259
Alternative solution https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/18742

Based on feedback from @bpasero 
Attempting to:
1. don't increase line height
1. solve without using js to monitor quick-open width
1. put the ellipsis `...` in the middle of the string

Notes:
- I did leave a little extra padding on the right side so that the path isn't covered by the split icon.
- Style wise it looks a little funny to me that the paths don't begin at the same column...
- The css selector is getting kind of long

![screen shot 2017-02-03 at 4 39 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/604015/22609478/5757a630-ea2f-11e6-92f2-1310c147a8f0.png)

data.title: Allow configuration/selection of Git commit behavior for untracked files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Near as I can tell, the default behavior of the checkmark in the Git panel is to commit all the shown changes: that is, both tracked and untracked files. #10448 allowed ignoring the untracked files in the badge counter, but the panel's behavior remains unchanged.

My expectation for a default action there is that it would be equivalent to either `git commit`, or `git commit -a`. If you stage something, you then get `git commit` behavior, but simple `git commit -a` doesn't seem to be available as far as I can tell.

A "Commit All Tracked" or similarly-named option in the panel's menu would be pretty useful by itself as an option, but the natural thing to me, given the existence of the setting controlling the badge counter, would be a parallel setting controlling what the default "nothing staged" commit button does: specifically wether it includes untracked files.

data.title: Module Typings won't get picked up.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win10x64
- npm Version: 4.1.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. npm i [upath@0.2.0](/anodynos/upath)
2. import it ``upath = require('upath')``
3. try to use it and witness no module members present in suggestions

![](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/105338698/ShareX/2017-02/Code_2017-02-03_20-01-50.png)

upath isn't present in DefinitelyTyped. It only has local typing: [package.json: "types": "./upath.d.ts"](/anodynos/upath/blob/master/package.json#L32). However post install this line transforms (in the local package.json) into

```
  "typescript": {
    "definition": "upath.d.ts"
  },
```
which apparently VSCode doesn't understand.

I don't know why does it happen. I have my own module, that I host on a private git server that I install via npm's git+ssh support and it doesn't change ``"types"`` into ``"typescript.definition"`` and in this case VSCode does pick up my local typings alright.

data.title: Bulk comment / uncomment is broken in certain cases
